item.title: Sara add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "There are certain queer times and occasions in this strange mixed affair we call life when a man takes this whole universe for a vast practical joke, though the wit thereof he but dimly discerns, and more than suspects that the joke is at nobody's expense but his own." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Sara add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "my good qualities are under your protection, and you are to exaggerate them as much as possible; and, in return, it belongs to me to find occasion for teasing and quarreling with you as often as may be..." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sara add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "That walls should fall is the consequence of blowing your own trumpet." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Sara add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Of course, people will laugh at you, but people laugh at a great many things so there is no need to take it personally." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Sara add a quote by John Irving
item.description:
"so my grandmother was not without humanity. and if she wore cocktail dresses when she labored in the garden, they were cocktail dresses she no longer intended to wear to cocktail parties. even in her rose garden she did not want to appear underdressed. if the dresses got too dirty from gardening, she threw them out. when my mother suggested to her that she might have them cleaned, my grandmother said, "what? and have those people at the cleaners what i was doing in a dress to make it that dirty?"
from my grandmother i learned that logic is relative." -- John Irving

item.title: Sara add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "norris didn't cry, but he was apt to puke on them, the way he had puked on homer gamache that time he had found homer sprawled in a ditch out by homeland cemetary, beaten to death with his own artificial arm." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ariana Franklin
item.description: "Welcome to the gates of heaven Adelia, and what did you do with your life? My Lord, I was a bishop's whore." -- Ariana Franklin

item.title: Sara add a quote by Scott Bradfield
item.description: "take words and make them useful,' she told me. 'drain them of all the crappy meanings they used to mean and make them mean something useful instead." -- Scott Bradfield

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ariana Franklin
item.description: "A daughter,' Rowley scooped up the child and held her high. The baby blinked from sleep and crowed with him. 'Any fool can have a son,' he said. 'It takes a man to conceive a daughter." -- Ariana Franklin

item.title: Sara add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I knew you would do me good in some way, at some time--I saw it in your eyes when I first beheld you." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Sara add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "you got a sad story, ruth,' mimba said. 'but not sad-sad. you here with me and cato and all us together now. you have a happy-sad story. best you can get in this life is happy-sad. but you always gotta remember your own mama that birthed you. even though you only got a crumb of her story, you still got to say her name out loud. you always honor your dead, else you get trouble from them, sure." -- Anita Diamant

item.title: Sara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "And we'd sit in the dry leaves that whispered a little with the slow respiration of our waiting and with the slow breathing of the earth and the windless october, the rank smell of the lantern fouling the brittle air, listening to the dog and the echo of louis' voice dying away" -- William Faulkner

item.title: Sara add a quote by John Sladek
item.description: "Yeah but Father, is that what you meant by God being a paradox? How he was so pleased to get a chance to nail his Son there that he even gave up his plan to fry the whole world in Hell?" -- John Sladek

item.title: Sara add a quote by John Sladek
item.description: "History is a bunk on which I am trying to awaken" -- John Sladek

item.title: Sara add a quote by John Sladek
item.description: "Music is the music of all music, and I am jealous." -- John Sladek

item.title: Sara add a quote by Richard Adams
item.description: "Nevertheless, the number of hoots I give for them is restricted to less than two." -- Richard Adams

item.title: Sara add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "She ran out of her marriage the way a woman can run out of a pair of sandals when she decides to let go and really dash." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sara add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "But if you call me Anne, please call me Anne with an 'e'." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "What a curious kind of fool a girl is. Never been licked in school. What's a licking?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Mrs. Norris hitched a breath and went on again." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sara add a quote by Joyce carol Oates
item.description: "A wet autumn morning, a garbage truck clattering down the street. The first snowfall of the season, blossom sized flakes falling languidly and melting on teh ground, a premature snow fall delicate as lace, rapidly melting." -- Joyce carol Oates

item.title: Sara add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Everything, decided Francie after that first lecture, was vibrant with life and there was no death in chemistry. She was puzzled as to why learned people didn't adopt chemistry as a religion." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Sara add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "He kissed her, he kissed her, he kissed her, little by little by little." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Sara add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "The body apologizes to the soul for its errors, and the soul asks forgiveness for squatting in the body without invitation." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Sara add a quote by Robin Hobb
item.description: "As I apologized to her a flicker of panic raced through me and then faded away. There wasn't enough life left in me to panic. I'd made a mistake and I was dying. Apparently not even a Speck afterlife was available to me. I'd simply stop being. Apparently I hadn't died correctly. Oops." -- Robin Hobb

item.title: Sara add a quote by Robin Hobb
item.description: "How different would our perception of reality be if... we discarded the mundane events that cannot coexist with our dreams?" -- Robin Hobb

item.title: Sara add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description:
"I was quite a looker in my time," she said. Was she reading his mind, or only being smart, to know she must be hideous?
"Oh, had they invented time as long ago as that?" -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Sara add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sara add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "During these mad dashes to the wall phone in the kitchen she hadn't time to fall but with fantastical grace and dexterity wrenched herself upright in midfall and continued running (dogs whimpering, yapping hysterically in her wake, cats scattering wide-eyed and plume-tailed) before the telephone ceased it's querulous ringing--though frequently she was greeted with nothing more than a derisive dial tone, in any case." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Sara add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "These are the seductive voices of the night; the Sirens, too, sang that way. It would be doing them an injustice to think that they wanted to seduce; they knew they had claws and sterile wombs, and they lamented this aloud. They could not help it if their laments sounded so beautiful." -- Franz Kafka
